items.title: Adding CPG Guidelines for MDN

items.content_html:
Description

Chrome 133 supports the FileSystemObserver interface, which allows you to observe changes to the underlying file system via a standard observer mechanism.

This PR adds documentation for the new functionality, which mainly consists of new reference pages for the new interface.

Note that the feature is currently non-standard (see whatwg/fs#165), although it should be added to the spec soon. I have currently documented it as such.

Motivation

Additional details

See the relevant ChromeStatus entry for data: https://chromestatus.com/feature/4622243656630272

Relevant blog post: https://developer.chrome.com/blog/file-system-observer#start_observing_a_file_or_directory

Related issues and pull requests

Related BCD: mdn/browser-compat-data#25986
items.title: Technical review: Document FileSystemObserver

items.content_html: Please see tc39/proposal-is-error#7 for implementation status. This is shipping flagged in Safari and by default in Chrome 134, but not much news from FF yet.
items.title: Reference for stage 3 is-error

items.content_html:
Fix #36376.

I didn't touch https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Performance/Web_Performance_Basics, because this claim is correct actually:

using a CDN to make your site more universally performant across the world

Though it may not improve the best-case or average-case performance, it does improve worst-case performance where the user is very far from your self-hosted server.
items.title: Expand CDN glossary entry

items.content_html:
Description

Addresses the dev-docs-needed requirements of Bug 1538451 Make extension shortcut management page accessible by a link/URL for a WebExtension by adding documentation for commands.openShortcutSetting along with accompanying release note.

Related issues and pull requests

BCD for commands.openShortcutSetting added in mdn/browser-compat-data#25944
items.title: Bug-1538451 documentation for `commands.openShortcutSetting`

items.content_html:
Description

Add note to start_url to warn users from leaving it unspecified

Motivation

Reading the documentation it sounds as if omitting start_url is valid as it leads to the default behavior of using the URL of the page that links to the manifest.
This PR adds a note to warn the user that this is not recommended as it leads to installability issues on chromium based browsers. Instead users should use "share_url": "./" to get the desired behavior without breaking installability.
items.title: Add note to `start_url` to warn users from leaving it unspecified

items.content_html:
Description
Added a section explaining how to use CSS animations with Flexbox. This new section includes a demonstration using https://github.com/Keyframes to animate flexible elements, as well as practical tips on animating Flexbox properties such as order, flex-grow and justify-content.

Motivation
This enhancement gives developers a better understanding of how to combine Flexbox and CSS animations to create more dynamic and interactive interfaces. Currently, the page doesn't cover this topic, even though it's common practice in modern web development.
items.title: [en] add a section on using CSS animations with Flexbox

items.content_html:
Description

Chrome 133 supports scroll-state container queries. See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5072263730167808.

This PR:

  • Updates the @container ref page to include details of all the scroll-state query types, and provides a quick example.
  • Updates the container-type ref page to include details of the scroll-state value.
  • Adds a separate guide to explain scroll-state container queries
  • Updates several other articles to link to the new content, and modify descriptions so they are still accurate now there are three container query types.

One thing to note — I've put the new guide under the CSS conditional rules docs tree, even though the other container query content is under the CSS containment docs tree. This is because all the container queries spec definitions have been moved under CSS conditional rules. At some point, we will need to move all the docs stuff over as well, so it matches the spec structure. I'm not sure if it is best to do that in this PR or leave it to another PR later on.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Related BCD: mdn/browser-compat-data#25941
items.title: Editorial review: Add docs for scroll-state container queries
